actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to H. Res. 1230. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on November 18, 2022.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed H.R. 8454 and made appointments to the Board of Trustees of the American Folklife Center of the Library of Congress.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

The House received a communication from Acting Chairwman Susan Wild and Acting Ranking Member Michael Guest, Committee on Ethics. Pursuant to Rule VII of the Rules of the House of Representatives, Acting Chairwoman Wild and Acting Ranking Member Guest notified the House that the Committee on Ethics had been served with a third-party subpoena to produce documents in the Superior Court of the District of Columbia and that after consultation with the Office of General Counsel, the Committee had determined that only partial compliance with the subpoena was consistent with the privileges and rights of the House.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Sheila Cherfilus-McCormick. Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick submitted her resignation from the Committee on Education and Labor. The resignation was accepted without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 402
actions-list.actionItem: 13 (Roll no. 485).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3630 — "To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide for coverage of certain lymphedema compression treatment items under the Medicare program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 414
actions-list.actionItem: 2, 1 Present (Roll no. 484).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2250 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the management of information technology projects and investments of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 418
actions-list.actionItem: 2, 2 Present (Roll no. 483).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 4359 — "To designate the regional office of the Department of Veterans Affairs in metropolitan Atlanta as the "Senator Johnny Isakson Department of Veterans Affairs Atlanta Regional Office", and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 359
actions-list.actionItem: 62, 2 Present (Roll no. 482).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 3369 — "To designate the medical center of the Department of Veterans Affairs in metropolitan Atlanta, Georgia, as the "Joseph Maxwell Cleland Atlanta Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center"."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

actions-list.header: On motion to Suspend the Rules and Pass Certain Bills Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 381
actions-list.actionItem: 39 (Roll no. 481).

The Chair announced that pursuant to H. Res. 1464, the ordering of the yeas and nays on postponed motions to suspend the rules with respect to such measures would be vacated to the end that all such motions would be considered as withdrawn.

Pursuant to section 2 of H. Res. 1464, Mr. Carter (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 4275, as amended; H.R. 5502, as amended; H.R. 5721, as amended; H.R. 6290, as amended; H.R. 7277, as amended; H.R. 7299, as amended; and H.R. 8416, as amended.

Mr. Carter (LA) asked unanimous consent that the ordering of the yeas and nays on the motion that the House suspend the rules and pass the bill S. 533 be vacated, to the end that the motion be considered as withdrawn. Agreed to without objection.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8416.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Carter (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8416 — "To improve individual assistance provided by the Federal Emergency Management Agency, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3092.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Carter (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. S. 3092 — "To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to improve the provision of certain disaster assistance, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Ann M. Kuster to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
